agent_utterance: It's a hot Tuesday afternoon in Suwon. Try this quick, low-effort plan: 1) Do a 2-minute box-breathing cycle (inhale 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4). 2) Drink 250 ml of cold water. 3) Log your urge and mood now. If the urge is still high (above 6/10), repeat another 2-minute breathing cycle, log again, and have a cooling, pre-portioned snack (e.g., cucumber slices, a small yogurt, or a piece of fruit) before logging once more. Keep water and cooling snacks within reach. You’re doing great—small steps today add up.

agent_utterance: Here’s a tight, actionable plan with a mid-day reminder and meal tips: 1) Log your urge and mood. 2) Set a quick mid-day reminder for a check-in around 1:45–2:00 PM local time (phone alarm or calendar alert). 3) If urge > 6/10, do 2 minutes of box breathing and sip 250 ml cold water. 4) Re-check urge; if still above 6/10, repeat breathing and then have a cooling, pre-portioned snack (cucumber, a small yogurt, or fruit) before logging again. Keep water and snacks nearby. 5) Meal plan for steadier intake: aim for regular meals every 3–4 hours, each with protein and fiber, plus 1–2 planned snacks as needed. Include lean proteins (chicken, fish, tofu), fiber-rich carbs (vegetables, whole grains, beans), and healthy fats. Prepare portions in advance to avoid last-minute choices. Stay hydrated and try to minimize long gaps between meals, especially on hot days. If BED symptoms persist or worsen, consider seeking guidance from a clinician or dietitian.
